reviews.review: It's Half-Life 2.

В этой игре нету:
- Подачи сюжета через записки/диктофоны.
- Унылого бэктрекинга ради растягивания процесса.
- Пустого опен-ворлда.
- Ненужной прокачки ради лже-ощущения прогресса. 
- Инвентаря с мусором.
- Гринда, фарма, крафта ради растягивания прохождения.
- Второстепенных заданий которые ни на что не влияют.
- Нелинейности которая ломает сюжет/канон.
- ДЛС, Сизон пас, премиум, микротранзакции, лутбоксы.
- Ненужного переусложненного управления с фичами которые используют только раз во время обучения.

Правильно, в этой игре нету ничего лишнего. Зато в этой игре есть:
- Замечательная графика, которая хорошо смотрится и сейчас благодаря гениальной роботе художника.
- Реалистичная физика, технологии. Весь уровень усеян объектами с которыми можно и нужно взаимодействовать, пространство чувствуется живее, нету ощущения стерильной комнаты, вы сейчас часто такое видите?
- Большое разнообразие оружия, универсальной имбы нету, патроны заканчиваются быстро, приходится использовать практически все, конечно с возможностью выбирать.
- Разнообразные локации. Игра ставит то узкие темные коридоры, то светлые просторные поляны. Ощущение одиночества и опасности чередуется с передышкой с компанией друзей в безопасности. Быстрый экшен, погоня на транспорте, а потом медитативное исследование локации. Игра дает обширный спектр эмоций. Идеальный баланс.
- Враги. Они действительно разные и запоминаются. Начинаем мы борьбу с мелкими летающими дронами, а заканчиваем с огромными триногами и вертолетами.
- Персонажи. Их мало, но все они запоминаются и все они к месту. Даже массовка - вроде парочки на диване врезаются в память.
- Сюжет. Великий сюжет, если вы его не поняли, просто проходите мимо, никто не будет бросать вам бисер.

Ну и конечно самое главное, в этой игре есть ГЕЙМПЛЕЙ. То о чем забывают рассказать маркетологи в трейлерах и на громких презентациях E3/Gamescom показывая очередной фальшивый пререндер. В эту игру нужно играть и наблюдать, вас не ведут за ручку от катсцены к катсцене, не заставляют смотреть в определенную точку, можно все проморгать (как было бы и в реальности), задачка не решается QTE или миниигрой в пятнашки - но все просто и элегантно. Играть нужно внимательно иначе пропускаются детали, моменты, но если ты их замечаешь то получаешь особое удовольствие. Тебе не указывают куда идти и что делать жирными маркерами, это понятно само собой и из разговоров. Эта игра совмещает в себе все лучшее. 
Half-Life 2 - шедевр.
[spoiler]Эта игра не сложная, но не простая; большая но компактная; разнообразная но без лишнего; про чистых, сильных людей в грязных руинах; про апокалипсис, но дает надежду.[/spoiler]

One of my favorite games of all time I think this is the best single player game from VALVE.

The now "classic" game that launched this whole "Steam" thing. It follows a similar formula as the original Half-Life but with a new story and a souped-up physics engine. I finished it years ago but I'm playing it again on a PC with better CPU and GPU specs where the HDR rendering really shows through without sacrificing frame rates. Plus I now get to rack up some Steam achievements that weren't around when I played it the first time!
Half life 2+mods=massive replay value. Well worth the price!

Half Life 2 has a good game buried in it, hidden under drawn-out real-time and unskippable story sequences and annoying physics puzzles. Most people don't seem to like the gunplay, but I still consider the feel of the guns in Half Life 2 to be something special. If you have enough patience to sit through the occasional several-minutes-long forced interaction sequence, then playing through Half Life 2 at least once should prove enjoyable.

Honestly, I always thought this was a bit overrated. The pacing was really bad, way too many segments where you're just driving, walking around empty spaces or waiting for dialogue or similiar, breaking the flow of the gameplay. The combat also doesn't feel very engaging and, unlike it's predecessor, requires almost no strategy whatsoever aside from "shoot the head" or "throw grenade at this position that's very obviously designed to have a grenade thrown at"

The source engine was and still is amazing, but from back when It first came out and even now I still fail to see the appeal of Half-Life 2's gameplay, which just feels vastly inferior to 1's in every possible way. The guns are pretty boring compared to 1's guns too. No gauss canon, no snarks, no laser mines, no nothing. Just the most generic bare minimum weapon variety any shooter could have. And the gravity gun is something you use during one chapter, ravenholm, and then almost never use again, unless a puzzle requires it.

This is by no means a bad game, infact it's very good, but honestly, I never liked it very much, and if you ask me it's probably the most overrated game of all time. There's way better singleplayer shooters out there that are similiar but more engaging. Even back then. As such, unless you want to experience a piece of gaming history, I can not recommend this game nowadays. Just get Black Mesa, the Half Life 1 remake, instead.

One of valve's greatest masterpieces, everyone who has a steam account should own this game.

Half Life 2, incredible and near perfect in everyway, is immersive, well constructed and engaging. The AI is extremely well programmed and various depending on the creature. Voice acting is outstanding, and storyline is well built. This game, unlike most modern games follows Valve's phillosophy well, 'The mechanics and gameplay MUST be simple to understand and use, but everything else can be complex'. The game never takes control away from you, there is never a cutscene or some sort 'point-of-view control'. Enemies are fun and challenging to fight, guns are unique and numerous, AI are engaging to 'talk' to as the voice acting for them is so damn good, and each line they say help you understand the story and world more. Although scripted, every single moment that is close to that of a 'cut-scene' is epic, well-crafted and completely grabs your attention as events of epic proportions unfold.

Near perfect, beautifully crafted

"Rise and shine, Dr. Freeman...Rise--and shine..." And thus begins anew the epic adventures of Dr. Gordon Freeman of the Black Mesa Research Facility, in a quest to liberate a conquered, dystopian future Earth ruled oppressively by a trans-dimensional alien empire known as the Combine. Once again, just like with their debut title, Valve has delivered a home-run video game experience worthy of the golden age franchises of Nintendo and SEGA that came before. With a wonderful, beautiful, but subtle bend of travel, exploration, and puzzle solving only interrupted briefly by intense firefights, Half-Life 2 brims with variety and cleverness rarely seen in modern games. Instead of only being allow to shoot at things--with no other meaningful way interact to the game world--Half-Life 2 allows you a variety of ways to play with the many items and objects you’ll come across, and it even makes puzzles that utilize these interactions. It is this first and foremost that makes Half-Life 2 amazing!
Probably the best sci-fi first person shooter ever!

The iconic!  The legendary!  It is Half-Life 2!  This masterpiece needs no introduction - nor a review by me.  Slightly dated, surely, but aren't all great games these days?  If you haven't played it, you probably don't like FPS titles... or crowbars.

Gordon Freeman and Alyx battle their way through hoardes of combine in City 17. This is a brilliant game, better than the original primarily on graphics and because of the gravity gun. I have 100%ed this game and still go back to play through again and again. Challenging, puzzling, entertaining and story driven gameplay make this game one of the top 5 of all time for me. Oh and I forgot, HL2 also implemented Valve's new physics engine for the first time and it worked a treat! A must have for any gamer - 10/10

Instant classic. It's hard to repeat how the original Half-Life rocked the PC game landscape, but Half-Life 2 pulls its own weight in this regard. Definately not to be missed. Where HL1's revolution was with in-game cinematic action sequences, never before seen AI, HL2 is centred around never before seen physics (not least of all, gameplay to articulate it) and stunning graphical polish.

(Un)fortunately in both cases, these have become assimilated as defacto standards in games following them, so if you didn't play the Half-Life games when they came out, you have probably seen it all before by now.
